availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Garrison (Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier in the 33rd and 26th KY)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Keziah J. Smith Garrison in Warren County, Kentucky, on August 27, 1856. Father of John W. Garrison, Sarah J. Garrison, Mary F. Garrison, and Thomas J. Garrison. Farmer in Warren County in 1860. Served in Company A 33rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from February 13, 1863, to April 1, 1864. Served in Company F 26th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from April 1, 1864, to June 30, 1865.Served in Company F 26th Kentucky Veteran Volunteer Infantry (U.S.A.) as a Private from June 30, 1865, to July 10, 1865.
